speaker: PARIS
text_entry: SCENE II. The same. Court of Pandarus' house.

speaker: PARIS
text_entry: Enter TROILUS and CRESSIDA

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: Dear, trouble not yourself: the morn is cold.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: Then, sweet my lord, I'll call mine uncle down;

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: He shall unbolt the gates.

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: Trouble him not;

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: To bed, to bed: sleep kill those pretty eyes,

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: And give as soft attachment to thy senses

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: As infants' empty of all thought!

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: Good morrow, then.

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: I prithee now, to bed.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: Are you a-weary of me?

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: O Cressida! but that the busy day,

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: Waked by the lark, hath roused the ribald crows,

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: And dreaming night will hide our joys no longer,

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: I would not from thee.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: Night hath been too brief.

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: Beshrew the witch! with venomous wights she stays

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: As tediously as hell, but flies the grasps of love

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: With wings more momentary-swift than thought.

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: You will catch cold, and curse me.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: Prithee, tarry:

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: You men will never tarry.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: O foolish Cressid! I might have still held off,

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: And then you would have tarried. Hark!

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: there's one up.

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: [Within]  What, 's all the doors open here?

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: It is your uncle.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: A pestilence on him! now will he be mocking:

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: I shall have such a life!

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: Enter PANDARUS

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: How now, how now! how go maidenheads? Here, you

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: maid! where's my cousin Cressid?

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: Go hang yourself, you naughty mocking uncle!

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: You bring me to do, and then you flout me too.

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: To do what? to do what? let her say

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: what: what have I brought you to do?

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: Come, come, beshrew your heart! you'll ne'er be good,

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: Nor suffer others.

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: Ha! ha! Alas, poor wretch! ah, poor capocchia!

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: hast not slept to-night? would he not, a naughty

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: man, let it sleep? a bugbear take him!

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: Did not I tell you? Would he were knock'd i' the head!

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: Knocking within

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: Who's that at door? good uncle, go and see.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: My lord, come you again into my chamber:

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: You smile and mock me, as if I meant naughtily.

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: Ha, ha!

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: Come, you are deceived, I think of no such thing.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: Knocking within

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: How earnestly they knock! Pray you, come in:

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: I would not for half Troy have you seen here.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: Exeunt TROILUS and CRESSIDA

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: Who's there? what's the matter? will you beat

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: down the door? How now! what's the matter?

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: Enter AENEAS

speaker: AENEAS
text_entry: Good morrow, lord, good morrow.

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: Who's there? my Lord AEneas! By my troth,

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: I knew you not: what news with you so early?

speaker: AENEAS
text_entry: Is not Prince Troilus here?

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: Here! what should he do here?

speaker: AENEAS
text_entry: Come, he is here, my lord; do not deny him:

speaker: AENEAS
text_entry: It doth import him much to speak with me.

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: Is he here, say you? 'tis more than I know, I'll

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: be sworn: for my own part, I came in late. What

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: should he do here?

speaker: AENEAS
text_entry: Who!--nay, then: come, come, you'll do him wrong

speaker: AENEAS
text_entry: ere you're ware: you'll be so true to him, to be

speaker: AENEAS
text_entry: false to him: do not you know of him, but yet go

speaker: AENEAS
text_entry: fetch him hither; go.

speaker: AENEAS
text_entry: Re-enter TROILUS

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: How now! what's the matter?

speaker: AENEAS
text_entry: My lord, I scarce have leisure to salute you,

speaker: AENEAS
text_entry: My matter is so rash: there is at hand

speaker: AENEAS
text_entry: Paris your brother, and Deiphobus,

speaker: AENEAS
text_entry: The Grecian Diomed, and our Antenor

speaker: AENEAS
text_entry: Deliver'd to us; and for him forthwith,

speaker: AENEAS
text_entry: Ere the first sacrifice, within this hour,

speaker: AENEAS
text_entry: We must give up to Diomedes' hand

speaker: AENEAS
text_entry: The Lady Cressida.

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: Is it so concluded?

speaker: AENEAS
text_entry: By Priam and the general state of Troy:

speaker: AENEAS
text_entry: They are at hand and ready to effect it.

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: How my achievements mock me!

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: I will go meet them: and, my Lord AEneas,

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: We met by chance; you did not find me here.

speaker: AENEAS
text_entry: Good, good, my lord; the secrets of nature

speaker: AENEAS
text_entry: Have not more gift in taciturnity.

speaker: AENEAS
text_entry: Exeunt TROILUS and AENEAS

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: Is't possible? no sooner got but lost? The devil

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: take Antenor! the young prince will go mad: a

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: plague upon Antenor! I would they had broke 's neck!

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: Re-enter CRESSIDA

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: How now! what's the matter? who was here?

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: Ah, ah!

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: Why sigh you so profoundly? where's my lord? gone!

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: Tell me, sweet uncle, what's the matter?

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: Would I were as deep under the earth as I am above!

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: O the gods! what's the matter?

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: Prithee, get thee in: would thou hadst ne'er been

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: born! I knew thou wouldst be his death. O, poor

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: gentleman! A plague upon Antenor!

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: Good uncle, I beseech you, on my knees! beseech you,

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: what's the matter?

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: Thou must be gone, wench, thou must be gone; thou

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: art changed for Antenor: thou must to thy father,

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: and be gone from Troilus: 'twill be his death;

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: 'twill be his bane; he cannot bear it.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: O you immortal gods! I will not go.

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: Thou must.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: I will not, uncle: I have forgot my father;

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: I know no touch of consanguinity;

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: No kin no love, no blood, no soul so near me

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: As the sweet Troilus. O you gods divine!

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: Make Cressid's name the very crown of falsehood,

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: If ever she leave Troilus! Time, force, and death,

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: Do to this body what extremes you can;

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: But the strong base and building of my love

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: Is as the very centre of the earth,

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: Drawing all things to it. I'll go in and weep,--

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: Do, do.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: Tear my bright hair and scratch my praised cheeks,

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: Crack my clear voice with sobs and break my heart

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: With sounding Troilus. I will not go from Troy.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: Exeunt
